function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Global increase in medical device sales","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of iot devices for tracking and surveillance may raise privacy concerns for individuals being monitored.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on iot devices for early diagnosis may lead to inaccurate results and mismanagement of covid-19 cases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization and regulation in the use of iot devices for pandemic management may result in inconsistent data collection and analysis.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on covid-19 and digital technologies may overlook other contagious diseases that pose a risk to public health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exploration of untested technologies for pandemic control","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address immediate problems during covid-19 crisis","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on safe living environments post-covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing reliance on digital technology for essential services","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Legal and ethical constraints of deploying emerging technology for disease surveillance and control","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks of accuracy, safety, protection, and data quality in disease surveillance and control technologies","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global pandemic infectious disease","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of iot and sensors in healthcare institutes","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of robots and drones in high-risk environments","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Socio-economic divide affecting housing options and access to home delivery","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cutting corners in affordable/social housing developments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of redundancy in bathroom and lavatory facilities in existing building stock","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic divide exposed by covid-19 related design concepts","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rear extensions do not allow for a ready installation of a containment space without sacrificing room functionality or garden space.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion of a front room into a containment space places the containment space in the heart of the sleeping quarters.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Recent homes with double garages at the front may require the owner to forgo a car parking space in order to insert a containment room module.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of living spaces may increase the risk of disease propagation due to close proximity of individuals","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historic buildings with limited modification possibilities may hinder the implementation of modern disease prevention measures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rear property extensions and lack of space for containment areas may limit the implementation of quarantine measures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced carrying capacity of elevators due to social distancing requirements","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for retrofitting existing building stock to pandemic-proof residential housing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emphasis on stairs as the main mode of inter-storey communication creating public health benefit","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Internal layout design impacting movement patterns and proximity of people","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narrow corridors and bottleneck positioning of doors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ventilation in corridor spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density housing and communal spaces can lead to a concentration of residents and increased flow of people, which can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial separation and narrow corridors can create bottlenefks and bottlenecks that increase the likelihood of close contact and the spread of pathogens between individuals passing through the area.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared access points and common bottlenecks in apartment buildings make them vulnerable to becoming hotspots for contagious diseases, leading to rapid transmission among residents.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adequate ventilation in housing design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sound dampening in interior spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shared central air-conditioning without individual filtration zones","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate airflow and ventilation in the built environment leading to the potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to open air spaces leading to confinement-related mental health issues in isolated occupants.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to observe social distancing guidelines in communal spaces, leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socialising in residential spaces may expose occupants to pathogens carried by visitors, including asymptomatic individuals with covid-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of living spaces due to external clothing and footwear being brought indoors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate hand hygiene facilities and access to wet cells bathrooms in proximity to the living space","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Permeable zone between exterior and interior in residential buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of virus deposits on items and clothing from external spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of universal design in residential structures for whole-of-life-stage use","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate containment space and functionality in residential buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to minimize the likelihood of virus transmission through structural, physical, and practical means","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dispersal of coronaviruses on surfaces in built environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Facilitated dispersal of sars-cov-2 in office environments and public transport systems with restricted airflow","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus survival on surfaces for prolonged periods","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
